task.title: How to Configure a MarkLogic Connection

prereq.p: Available in the Enterprise edition only. supports MarkLogic version 4.0 or later.

context.p: To configure a connection to a MarkLogic database, follow these steps:

step.cmd: Select a previously configured MarkLogic data source from the Data Source drop-down menu.

substep.cmd: The host name or IP address of the installed MarkLogic engine in the XDBC Host field.
substep.info: uses XCC connector to interact with MarkLogic XDBC server and requires the basic authentication schema to be set. Starting with version MarkLogic 4.0 the default authentication method when you create an HTTP or WebDAV Server is digest, so make sure to change it to basic.

substep.cmd: Set the port number of the MarkLogic engine in the Port field. A MarkLogic XDBC application server must be configured on the server on this port. This XDBC server will be used to process XQuery expressions against the server. Later, if you want to change the XDBC server, instead of editing the configuration just use the Use it to execute queries action from Data Source Explorer.
Set the user name to access the MarkLogic engine in the User field.
Set the password to access the MarkLogic engine in the Password field.
Optionally set the URL used for browsing the MarkLogic database in the Data Source Explorer view in the WebDAV URL field.
substep.info: The Database field specifies the database for which the XQuery expressions are executed. If you set this option to default, the database associated to the application server of the configured port is used.

step.cmd: To view your connection, go to the Data Source Explorer view or switch to the Database perspective.
